$DOGE ü§ë Dogecoin recovers above MA200 ¬∑ First green week since September 2025

#Dogecoin #DOGE #DOGEUSDT

MA200 is the most important of the moving averages to gauge the long-term potential of a trading pair. Here DOGEUSDT moved below MA200 and then closed two weekly sessions below this level. As soon as the action recovers, as it is happening, we get the best possible market conditions.

The weekly session still has two days before closure. It will be the biggest green candle since September 2025, also the first green candle with a bullish bias since that same month. The bearish period was brutal, straight down, but it is now over; we are going straight up.

On the chart you can see two targets mainly, $0.33 followed by $0.72. If you check the trade-numbers here, you can find even more targets all the way up to $1.1111.

How far up will Dogecoin go? 

It is too early to say but we are entering a major bullish wave for the altcoins market. It is safe to go all-in now spot or margin. Whatever you do, just buy and hold. The market will take care of the rest.

Growth will be so fast that the entry price will not available after two days. If you miss the entry when prices are low, it becomes hard to hold when there are fluctuations. If you manage to enter early, you can rest/hold easily when the market shakes.

Take action now. If in doubt, just enter with 2-3X. Follow the numbers for best results.

I am wishing you tons of success, good profits and great luck.

Namaste.

DOGE / USDT, 4H

 $DOGE is currently respecting a rising trendline that has guided price action for weeks. The recent pullback looks corrective, not impulsive, suggesting sellers are losing strength rather than taking control.

Price is now reacting around a key demand zone (green area), where buyers previously stepped in aggressively. As long as this zone holds, DOGE remains structurally bullish on the 4H timeframe.

The blue trendline acts as dynamic support, and the current consolidation above it increases the probability of a continuation move upward. A clean hold here could open the door for a push back toward the previous highs.

However, if price loses the trendline and fails to reclaim the demand zone, we could see a deeper retrace toward the lower liquidity area marked by the red arrow.

Bias: Bullish while above trendline
Invalidation: Clean breakdown below demand

Not financial advice. Just structure.
